description: Cluster designed for tagging OSINT artifacts that relate to the taxonomy language found in either the HITRUST Threat Catalogue or the ENISA Threat Taxonomy.
name: OSRS Operational Framewrok - Failure Threat
source: HITRUST Threat Catalogue and the ENISA Threat Taxonomy

values.description: Failure or disruption of third party services required for proper operation of information systems. For example, resources or supporting systems.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Failure Threat: HITRUST LUF1 3rd Party Services

values.description: A database failure which may result in systems or applications not being available, which can have a significant impact to business operations resulting in financial loss or potential brand damage.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Failure Threat: HITRUST LUF2 Database Systems

values.description: When the bandwidth of the network is insufficient, the transmission rate in the network and eventually the availability in the network will be severely limited to the organization's users resulting in potential business disruptions.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Failure Threat: HITRUST LUF3 Network Bandwidth

values.description: The process of selecting a path for traffic in a network, or between or across multiple networks.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Failure Threat: HITRUST LUF4 Network Routing

values.description: The failure of programs and other operations used by a computer.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Failure Threat: HITRUST LUF5 Software OR Code

values.description: The retention of retrievable data on a computer or other electronic system (memory).
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Failure Threat: HITRUST LUF6 Storage

values.description: The failure and (or) malfunction of Virtual parts and components of IT hardware (e.g. motherboard, CPU, RAM, video card, hard drive, power supply). Failure of Virtual IT.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Failure Threat: HITRUST LUF7 Virtual Parts & Components

values.description: Failure or disruption of third party services required for proper operation of information systems. For example, supplies or resources.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Failure Threat: HITRUST PUF1 3rd Party Services

values.description: Failure of communications links due to problems with cable networks.  For example, copper or fiber cabling.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Failure Threat: HITRUST PUF2 Cable

values.description: a special form of line impairment, caused by currents and voltages of signals transmitted over adjacent lines. This may result in the disclosure of sensitive information.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Failure Threat: HITRUST PUF3 Cross-talk

values.description: Power failure with the potential to cause asset damage or unavailability.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Failure Threat: HITRUST PUF4 Electric Power
OSRS Operational Framework Failure Threat: HITRUST PUF5 Equipment Fire

values.description: Failure to maintain atmospheric conditions for assets.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Failure Threat: HITRUST PUF6 Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning (HVAC)

values.description: Failure or malfunction of parts and components of IT hardware (e.g. motherboard, CPU, RAM, video card, hard drive, power supply).
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Failure Threat: HITRUST PUF7 IT Hardware

values.description: Failure of facility plumbing including gas and water systems.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Failure Threat: HITRUST PUF8 Plumbing

values.description: Fluctuations in the supply voltage can result in malfunctions and damage to IT systems.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Failure Threat: HITRUST PUF9 Voltage

values.description: Failure of communications links due to problems with wireless networks. e.g. radio or RF.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Failure Threat: HITRUST PUF10 Wireless

values.description: Threat of failure of IT hardware and, or software assets or its parts. May include failure of defective data media, hardware failures, application failures, and failure of device parts.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Failure Threat: ENISA Failure of Devices or Systems
